name: History of  Food Lore Quiz | History of Food | 10 Questions

questions.text: What plant did Joan of Arc possess, which led to the judgment of her guilt and eventual death?
questions.explanation:
mandrake.

	The Mandrake was thought to be a human quim. It was found generally under the gallows.  Along with tomatoes, they were both thought to be possessed by demons.

questions.text: When a Hindu women performs "sati" what type of plant does she wear on her hair?
Montezuma drank 50 gallons of chocolate called Itzpacalatl. What was so unusual about it?
questions.explanation:
mixed with blood.

	The royal cocoa were called pataxtle. It was buried underground for one year then turned into a foamy substance called espuma. They also created a drink called tlatqueztli which was made with chili peppers.

questions.text: When the Europeans came to Central America, they enjoyed eating llamas. What was so unusual about the stew they cooked?
options: the fur was used in the stew

questions.text: The Koreans believe that their first king descended from an egg laid by Pegasus. What color was the egg?
Which of the following is considered one possible explanation for the "manna of Earth", as referred to in the Bible?
questions.explanation:
lichen.

	Lecanora esculenta are blown off cliffs in the Middle East, then they are mixed with anise and honey.

questions.text: Which bird is force-fed four times its size and eaten au naturel by the French?
questions.explanation:
ortolan.

	Songbirds, buntings, are outlawed. They are still trapped illegally, and force-fed until they reach 4x their normal size. Then they are heated in the oven for 6 minutes and doused in Amargnac. Finally, the person eating the poor bird is blind-folded and the bird is swallowed, except for the head- it is bitten off.

questions.text: Motsu-yakitori is a Japanese sheesh kabob. What is it made from?
What caused the Chapati Movement of 1857 in India?
questions.correct: it was believed cow meat was mixed into the bread or flour
options: the English food was not amenable to the Indian taste bud
caste systems were fuddled by the British
questions.explanation:
it was believed cow meat was mixed into the bread or flour.

	No one really knows how this insane event started. However some claim it started with a chain letter. 4 chapati breads were given out to every village and then a rumour started that the British were adding cow's parts into the bread. The Hindu soldiers went a bit wild and started killing the English officers...then the British government decided to take India under its "protection".

questions.text: Who invented the mashed potato recipe 'puree de pomme de terre'?
questions.explanation:
Robuchon.

	Ingredients for pomme: 2 lbs of potato (la ratte), sea salt. one cup of butter, one cup of milk....place potato in water with sea salt- one table- spoon per quart. Simmer for 30 minutes. Drain and peel. Grind etc....mix the rest of the junk into it...voila!
